results.title: Metformin modulates mitochondrial autophagy in renal tubular epithelial injury induced by high glucose via the Keap1/Nrf2 pathway.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ modulates mitochondrial autophagy in @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002277 @@@renal tubular epithelial injury@@@ induced by high @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ via the @GENE_KEAP1 @GENE_50868 @@@Keap1@@@/@GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_18024 @@@Nrf2@@@ pathway.

citations.NLM: Sun D, Li H, Du Y, Chen Y, Yao L, Wang L. Metformin modulates mitochondrial autophagy in renal tubular epithelial injury induced by high glucose via the Keap1/Nrf2 pathway. Mol Cell Biochem. 2023 Oct 13;():. PMID: 37831352

results.title: Modulatory effects of metformin on mutagenicity and epithelial tumor incidence in doxorubicin-treated Drosophila melanogaster.
results.text_hl: Modulatory effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on mutagenicity and @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002277 @@@epithelial tumor@@@ incidence in @CHEMICAL_Doxorubicin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004317 @@@doxorubicin@@@-treated @SPECIES_7227 @@@Drosophila melanogaster@@@.

results.title: Metformin inhibits growth of thyroid carcinoma cells, suppresses self-renewal of derived cancer stem cells, and potentiates the effect of chemotherapeutic agents.
results.text_hl: The growth-inhibitory effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was, however, not restricted to differentiated thyroid cells and @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002277 @@@undifferentiated thyroid carcinoma@@@ cells but was also demonstrated in @DISEASE_Thyroid_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D013964 @@@thyroid carcinoma cancer@@@ stem cells.

citations.NLM: Chen G, Xu S, Renko K, Derwahl M. Metformin inhibits growth of thyroid carcinoma cells, suppresses self-renewal of derived cancer stem cells, and potentiates the effect of chemotherapeutic agents. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2012 Apr;97(4):E510-20. PMID: 22278418
